TIER 3 - Industrial (commodity) >>> Optimal Economy >> Suitable Hospitals X Inadvisable Weapons, Tools
Tools Recommended: None Notes: Apparel made from this is equipped much faster
High-density polyethylene is one of the three main commodity plastics. It can be used for many practical applications, but isn't especially outstanding in any regard except weight and production speed. It's resistant to harsh solvents and cleaning products making it an good material for hospitals and kitchens.

RecipeDef.label: Make ABS Plastic x20
RecipeDef.description:
TIER 3 - Industrial (engineering) >>> Optimal Production >> Suitable Riot Control Weapons and Armor (moderate), Furniture X Inadvisable Kitchens
Tools Recommended: Bladed (fair) Notes: Apparel made from this is equipped much faster
Riding the line between a commodity and engineering plastic, Acrylonitrile-butadiene-styrene is a strong, stiff plastic. It's easier to work with than even HDPE, though more difficult to produce. It's scratch-resistant and shiny due to the styrene, heat reistant due to the acrylonitrile, and has high impact resistance due to the butadiene rubber. It can actually be used to make somewhat adequate knives and tools. If you've ever stepped on a lego, you've experienced just how hard and sharp ABS can be.

RecipeDef.description:
TIER 3 - Industrial (commodity) >>> Optimal Glass substitute >> Suitable Furniture X Inadvisable Armor, Tools
Tools Recommended: None Notes: Apparel made from this is equipped much faster
Plexiglass is transparent Polymethyl methacrylate, or acrylic glass. It's stronger than glass, but much weaker than polycarbonate, and unlike glass, can be used in many of the same applications as plastics.

Polycarbonate is a clear plastic which is often used for bulletproof glass and riot gear. It has high impact strength but because it is very stiff, it will shatter faster than soft and flexible polyethylene.

Tools Recommended: Tree-cutting (fair) Notes: Apparel made from this is equipped much faster
Glass-fiber reinforced plastic is a composite material of glass fibers set into a thermoset polymer matrix. It's lightweight and easy to work with and builds sturdy structures. It's popular for its insulation properties and can even be used to fabricate armor which is strong against energy weapons, or cheap gear for firefighters.
